summary: 17 CFR § 240.14a-8 outlines the conditions under which a company must include a shareholder's proposal in its proxy materials for shareholder meetings, detailing eligibility requirements and procedural steps for submission. Shareholders must meet specific ownership thresholds and provide written statements of intent to hold securities and availability for discussions. The company can exclude proposals under certain conditions, subject to SEC review.
